chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
items.plainText: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

items.text: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
items.plainText: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

items.text: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
items.plainText: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

items.text: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
items.plainText: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

items.text: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
items.plainText: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

items.text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
items.plainText: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

items.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
items.plainText: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

items.text: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
items.plainText: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

items.text: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
items.plainText: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

items.text: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
items.plainText: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

items.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
items.plainText: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

items.text: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
items.plainText: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

items.text: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
items.plainText: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

items.text: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
items.plainText: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

items.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
items.plainText: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

items.text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
items.plainText: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

items.text: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
items.plainText: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

items.text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
items.plainText: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

items.text: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
items.plainText: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

items.text: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
items.plainText: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

items.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
items.plainText: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

items.text: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
items.plainText: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

items.text: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
items.plainText: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

items.text: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
items.plainText: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

items.text: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:
items.plainText: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:

items.text: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
items.plainText: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

items.text: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
items.plainText: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

items.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
items.plainText: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

items.text: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
items.plainText: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

items.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
items.plainText: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

items.text: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
items.plainText: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

items.text: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
items.plainText: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

items.text: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
items.plainText: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
